PacFIN.Utilities 0.2.5
  • Reference

    Filter samples for appropriate ages and agemethods.

    cleanAges.Rd

    cleanAges is now defunct and and users now only need to run cleanPacFIN() rather than both functions.

    cleanAges(
  Pdata,
  keep_age_methods = c("B", "S", ""),
  minAge = 1,
  maxAge = NULL,
  CLEAN = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    Pdata

    A PacFIN dataset

    keep_age_methods

    By default, methods "B","S" and "" are retained.

    minAge

    Minimum age to retain; default is 1.

    maxAge

    Maximum age to retain; default (NULL) returns all ages greater than minAge.

    CLEAN

    Default is TRUE. If FALSE, return the input data unchanged.

    Value

    The input data filtered for age methods and minimum and maximum ages specified, with added column age. A brief report on filtering is output to the console.

    Details

    Age methods "1" and "2" are equivalent to "B" and "S" respectively, and are reset to those values.

    No ages less than one occur in the commercial dataset. Zero ages are equivalent to NA.

    See also

    cleanPacFIN, sink

    Author

    Andi Stephens

    Contents

    Developed by Kelli F. Johnson, Andi Stephens.
